Bio

My research interests lie in deep learning, generative models, and computer graphics. I aim to enhance the understanding of human motions and integrate AI into the 3D animation production pipeline. My recent work has focused on both kinematic and physically based motion generation. My recent work has concentrated on both kinematic and physically-based motion generation.

I'm a PhD student at Simon Fraser University, advised by Professor Xue Bin Peng. Before joining SFU, I worked at Shanghai AI Lab with Jingbo Wang, and XMOV with Congyi Wang. I received my M.Sc. from NYU in 2020 under the supervision of Yi Fang. I received dual B.Sc. from Tongji University and Politecnico di Torino.
